data.title: Long Lived Excellence
data.text: The year was 1951, perhaps 1952, when I first went to Casper's Hot Dogs on Macdonald Ave. in Richmond. I was a student at Ells Jr. High School and had my first Casper's hot dog. 65 years later I went out of my way to have another since I now live in WA State. Over the years when living in CA and teaching near by in Richmond, I ate hundreds of these delicious delicacies. They were known for their "crunch" when bitten and the large fresh tomato wedges and fresh slices of onions (later on you could get warm kraut). It had been almost 25 years since I had one. Well, it was worth the wait! Nice to see that the dogs I remembered had not been compromised. Same wonderful taste, same crunch on being bitten. Caspers was surgical room like clean. The counter attendants were friendly and efficient. One can rarely relive a great experience, especially after 25 years. This was such a treat. I plan to come back in far fewer years. If anyone is in Richmond, CA and you want to see what  great hot dog tastes like, go down Macdonald Ave, across from the City Center, and have a couple of Casper Dogs. The regular are 80% beef and 20% pork. They also offer 100% beef dogs. Whichever one you get, you will love it.

data.title: Casper's Hot Dogs Are the Best!
data.text: Love their chili cheese dogs and chicken tamales.  I wish they still offered milkshakes instead of the slushes.

data.title: I grew up eating dogs at this place
data.text: There is something about the snap in these traditional dogs. Nothing fancy, just good old taste of days gone by hot dogs with all the trimmings. It's a through-back to the 50's. Mostly take out, but you can sit if you get there early.

data.title: This lil food stand has historical and political connections.
data.text: Best lil hotdog food stand in town... been around for over 40 years... good central location to city hall and other city-based agencies. Very popular place to get a quick bite to eat and get back to work on time. Floor to ceiling windows so you can get a good eye view of the local flare.

data.title: Decades of experience
data.text: I have been going to Casper's in one or another of its locations for 50 years. You can count on the same delicious hot dog and trimmings and the friendly service by mostly older women, bless 'em!.

data.title: oldie but godie!
data.text:
Accord to my husband and friends this place has been at this place for years and it continues delivering the same quality food and service for several decades now!
He and my mother-in-law loves to stop by if in the area! And now, I guess he is passing his love for hot dogs to our three years old daughter! So, I think we will stay making several visits to Casper's Hot Dogs for many years to come!

data.title: the best
data.text: These hot dogs are the best in the world when you order just tell them you want a Casper dog with everything also a bag of chips and a soft drink from that day on when you want a hot dog you will find a Caspers

data.title: Still great hot dogs (ate two!!!) but no more milkshakes!
data.text: Another very disappointed customer left with granddaughter when sent to neighboring McDonald's to get a milkshake.  Lots of people EXPECT milkshakes at Casper's, and this doesn't set well with old timers.  Plus, having lived on the east coast and getting familiar with Smith hot dogs, Caspers is very good but no longer the best.  Will still shop at Caspers, but their customers want shakes!  (Nation's Hamburgers is able to do shakes, and so should they).

data.title: Caspers.... still as good as when I ate there as a kid in the 60's
data.text: Living now on the east coast, Caspers is one of those bay area places I miss.  Love their hot dogs though I always have them hold the relish.  Love the tomato slices, onions and mustard, and one of the best hot dogs there is!  Costco members and other stores in the bay area sell Caspers hot dog 1 and 2 pound packs, but that misses the social fun of being at Caspers.  Another chain Kaspers likewise is in the bay area and also of the same high quality!  Limited menu choices, but for a good hot dog, this is the place!

data.title: A Richmond Landmark and the Best Hot Dogs in the World
data.text: A return visit to my hometown has to include a Casper's Hot Dog. Located across from the Richmond Civic Center, it has been in the same location for at least 50 years. They only serve Hot Dogs and they are the best I have ever have. Foot Long on a hot steamed bun with everything on them from the usual mustard and relish to sliced onion and tomato. Can get crowded during weekday lunch, but well worth any wait.

data.title: One of the Best, if Not the Best Hot Dog
data.text: Casper's Hot Dogs is one of the Best, if Not the Best Darn Hot Dog ever. It's been around ever since I was kid growing up in the Richmond area.  Located in Downtown Richmond on MacDonald Ave across from the Richmond Library.  These Dogs have one of the best tasting with the right amount of  condiments you can ask for.  The Casper dog comes standard with Mustard, Relish, sliced Onion (You can always gete chopped Onions) and sliced tomatoes.  They now sell the Hot Dogs them selfs at Safeway and Raley's in the refigeration meat department.  Enjoy!!

data.title: when you're in the mood...
data.text: when you're in the mood for hot dogs, they have them and they're delicious

data.title: Good Time High 1964 Bret Harte H.S.
data.text:
The memories from school days and after church lunch with my family bring back the flavor even in 1983 when attending UCBerk. and traveling by BART to the computer center with three Casper`s dogs under my arm, Now in chile, nothings the same, thanks for the memories

Dave
